itemDescription: Irish rugby union footballer and coach

wikipedia_page.main: Justin Michael Fitzpatrick (born 21 November 1973) is an Irish former rugby union player who most recently was head coach of the Houston SaberCats of Major League Rugby (MLR). He previously played for London Irish, Castres Olympique, Dungannon RFC & Ulster. He had also held several other coaching positions, including head coach of Dungannon RFC and the Seattle Saracens, and assistant coach of the United States national rugby union team.

response: *Justin Fitzpatrick (born 1973), Irish rugby union player and coach

link_mentions.page: Rugby union in the United States
response: The development of a domestic professional rugby competition is seen as a key step in the growth of rugby in the United States."Soldier On: What next for American rugby?", ESPN Scrum, November 3, 2014. USA Rugby CEO Nigel Melville predicted in 2012 that professional rugby would come to the United States by 2015."Are Americans warming up to rugby? Why it may be the sport's time to shine", Guardian, 24 June 2012. Retrieved 4 October 2014. Melville was quoted in 2014 as saying "We can do it in two years, it will be city-driven and we will start with six [teams] and we will go from there." U.S. national team assistant coach Justin Fitzpatrick said in 2015 that by 2016 the U.S. will have resolved to create a professional domestic rugby competition."The Pumas way is the American way", Gulf Times, September 21, 2015.

link_mentions.page: 1998 Ireland rugby union tour of South Africa
response: Justin Fitzpatrick and Trevor Brennan also made their senior international debuts in the same game. A fourth debutant, Justin Bishop, scored a try while Eric Elwood added a conversion and two penalties.   www.irishrugby.ie South Africa won the series 2-0, but unfortunately the series was marred by violence and ill-will between the two teams.
